title: Why economists say monopoly is inefficient

content.question: Most economists argue that a monopoly is inefficient because it

choices.label: has no incentive to minimize its costs
produces too little output and sets a price above marginal cost
earns too much profit by charging consumers any price it wants
producesÂ too much output and thus wastes scarce resources
usually produces unsafe products if not regulated by government

content.answer: produces too little output and sets a price above marginal cost
